intro: Veronica borisovae, commonly known as the Borisofovsky speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
